content: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI): Bacterial infection of urinary system. Lower (cystitis): dysuria, frequency, urgency, suprapubic pain, hematuria. Upper (pyelonephritis): fever, flank pain, CVA tenderness, nausea/vomiting. Diagnosis: UA shows WBC, bacteria, nitrites, leukocyte esterase; urine culture >10^5 CFU/mL (gold standard). Complicated UTI: male, pregnant, catheterized, anatomic abnormality, immunosuppressed, recent antibiotics, symptoms >7d. Organisms: E. coli (80%), Klebsiella, Proteus, Enterococcus, Pseudomonas (nosocomial). Treatment: uncomplicated cystitis (nitrofurantoin, TMP-SMX); pyelonephritis (fluoroquinolone or ceftriaxone); complicated (broad-spectrum, culture-guided). Complications: sepsis, renal abscess, chronic pyelonephritis. Risk factors: female, sexual activity, catheter, DM, obstruction.
name: UTI - Clinical Features & Management
